alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Appomattox; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Appomattox, southwestern Buckingham and southeastern Amherst Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Naola to near Spout Spring to near Sheppards. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amherst... Appomattox... Madison Heights... Appomattox National Historic Park... Sheppards... Andersonville... and Stonewall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
